author: poojaranjan
content:
> Thanks <@!642887713246150666> One of things I care about a lot is the proliferation of EIP statuses.
<@!683653554631868440> For EIP statuses, I think, based on discussions in EIPIP meeting, a set of agreed upon statuses were announced in one of the all core dev meeting. A week past the announcement, a PR to EIP-1 is submitted to add new/renamed statuses https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2996

author: poojaranjan
content: Agenda for next EIPIP meeting is https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/issues/38

author: poojaranjan
content: I'd be happy to add this or any other item from the comments, if you're available to discuss.

author: sky.cactus
content: Can someone kick the greeter?  It seems to be broken and it is blocking PR merges.

author: sky.cactus
content:
```
  npm notice 
  npm notice New patch version of npm available! 7.0.2 -> 7.0.3
  npm notice Changelog: <https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v7.0.3>
  npm notice Run `npm install -g npm@7.0.3` to update!
  npm notice 
  npm ERR! Maximum call stack size exceeded
  
  npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
  npm ERR!     /root/.npm/_logs/2020-10-23T17_35_40_425Z-debug.log
  The command '/bin/sh -c npm install --production' returned a non-zero code: 1
```

author: sky.cactus
content: Seems to be a global issue for everyone using this.

author: sky.cactus
content: *grumble* at auto-updates in widely used tools...

author: sky.cactus
content: Will disable the action tomorrow if there isn't a patch out.

author: gcolvin
content:
<@!642887713246150666>  Thanks.  I did see that PR, but didn't review it.  It's not a blocking  objection, I'm just not seeing any need for the Review and Living statuses.  Because it goes against the editors "original intent" of a simple, linear process.  And, as a practical matter,  drafts are always subject to review at their  discussions-to links. 
 (Unfortunately this EIP-1 draft has none. )
